paragraphs.content: Out of the depths have I cried unto thee, O LORD.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Out of the depths have I cried unto thee, O Lord.

paragraphs.content: Lord, hear my voice: let thine ears be attentive to the voice of my supplications.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Lord, hear my voice: let thine ears be attentive to the voice of my supplications.

paragraphs.content: If thou, LORD, shouldest mark iniquities, O Lord, who shall stand?
paragraphs.contentHtml: If thou, Lord, shouldest mark iniquities, O Lord, who shall stand?

paragraphs.content: But there is forgiveness with thee, that thou mayest be feared.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But there is forgiveness with thee, that thou mayest be feared.

paragraphs.content: I wait for the LORD, my soul doth wait, and in his word do I hope.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I wait for the Lord, my soul doth wait, and in his word do I hope.

paragraphs.content: My soul waiteth for the Lord more than they that watch for the morning: I say, more than they that watch for the morning.
paragraphs.contentHtml: My soul waiteth for the Lord more than they that watch for the morning: I say, more than they that watch for the morning.

paragraphs.content: Let Israel hope in the LORD: for with the LORD there is mercy, and with him is plenteous redemption.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let Israel hope in the Lord: for with the Lord there is mercy, and with him is plenteous redemption.

paragraphs.content: And he shall redeem Israel from all his iniquities.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And he shall redeem Israel from all his iniquities.
